Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; exterior: narrow black band on top of rim; lip and handle zone reserved with band between; body glazed below; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the rim and body find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C. These cups are both amongst the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villiard's Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.258) (Phase 3)
